titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York University Archives Collection of the New Yorker (student publication) RG.39.211
titlestmt.author: John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 14:39:16 -0500.

did.unittitle: New York University Archives Collection of the New Yorker (student publication)
did.abstract: This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the New Yorker, dating from 1907 to 1922. The paper was published by NYU University College of Arts and Science and School of Engineering students at the University Heights campus in the Bronx. The paper documented campus life, local news, athletics, and other student activities. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collection includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies. The publication is unrelated to the weekly magazine of the same name.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: New York University has had many student newspapers since its founding. The University Heights campus and the Washington Square campus had separate student newspapers until 1973 when the University Heights campus closed.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection, which were created in 1907-1922, are in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Researchers must consult microfilm copies due to the fragility of the original newspapers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Collection of the New Yorker (student publication); RG 39.211; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Bound volumes were rehoused by the NYU Barbara Goldsmith Preservation and Conservation Department in 2019.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the New Yorker, dating from 1907 to 1922. The paper was published by NYU University College of Arts and Science and School of Engineering students at the University Heights campus in the Bronx. The paper documented campus life, local news, athletics, and other student activities. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collections includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies. The publication is unrelated to the weekly magazine of the same name.
